job.title: Systems Engineer II - TTWCS/TMPC Test and Evaluation
job.description: ltstronggtSEA CORPltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltstronggtLocationltstronggt Middletown RIltbrgtltstronggtReq IDltstronggt req67ltbrgtltstronggtEmployee Statusltstronggt Full TimeltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtSystems Engineer II  TTWCSTMPC Test and EvaluationltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtUndersea on the surface or in the air SEACORP leverages our software and engineering expertise to deliver cutting edge warfare systemsltbrgtltbrgtWe are searching for an experienced ltstronggtSystems Engineer II  TTWCSTMPC Test and Evaluationltstronggt at our Middletown RI location ltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtPrimary Duties and ResponsibilitiesltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtThe Systems Engineer II  TTWCSTMPC Test and Evaluation will performSystem Test and Evaluation activities of the Submarine Tomahawk Weapon Systemsin laboratory and shipboard environments Duties includeltbrgtltulgtltligtWritten Test Procedureand Test Plan Development in accordance with System SpecificationsltligtltligtConfiguration and certification of system test environment in preparation toconduct formal system test ltligtltligtExecute System test procedures record and evaluateresults to determine if system performance meets design specificationsltligtltligtPreparing written reports to include daily laboratory logs problem reportstest reports and test metrics ltligtltligtAdditional duties include collaboration withsystem developers to assist with problem investigation and resolution ltbrgtltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtTravelltbrgtltbrgtltstronggt10ltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtWork Environment ampamp Physical DemandsltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtStanding and walking for extended periods of time  High probability of working in confined spaces where movement is restricted movement through narrow passageways and hatches  Significant use of hands to operate equipment and tools  Occasional lifting ltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtEligibility RequirementsltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtEducation A Bachelors Degree in an Engineering discipline is required The advanced technical training curricula packages provided to former military personnel such as Navy Technical Training A or B School or Naval Advanced Training C School along with time in service can potentially be used as an education equilency in some cases ltbrgtExperience 3  years of related experience is required Ideal candidates will have experience in the operation and maintenance of the BYG1 Combat Control System and Submarine TTWCSltbrgtClearance Required  SecretltbrgtltbrgtSuccessful candidates will enjoy competitive wages and a very rich benefit program includingltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtMedical BenefitsDentalVisionltstronggtChoice of two medical programs through Blue Cross ampamp Blue Shield a best in class Dental plan offered through Delta Dental and Vision offered through VSPltbrgtltstronggtRetirement Benefitsltstronggt A qualified 401k Retirement Savings Account with a generous 100 employer matching contribution on up to 8 of your eligible compensation ltbrgtltstronggtTimeOff Benefits ltstronggtTen 10 Paid Holidays per year and a generous Paid Time Off PTO policy to ensure that you can take time away from work for the things that are most important to you ltbrgtltstronggtAdditional Benefitsltstronggt Tuition Reimbursement Training ampamp Development Opportunities Referral Bonuses Life Insurance Short ampamp LongTerm Disability Insurance and many moreltbrgtltbrgtWe welcome you to apply for this exciting opportunity to support us in our mission to provide superior engineering support to the US NavyltbrgtltbrgtSEACORP is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with all applicable federal state and local fair employment practices laws SEACORP strictly prohibits and does not tolerate
